metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7910 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the disk_seqf_stop function in block/genhd.c in the Linux kernel before 4.7.1 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging the execution of a certain stop operation even if the corresponding start operation had failed. It was discovered that a use-after-free vulnerability existed in the block device layer of the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-38-generic - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-lowlatency - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-4.4.0-38-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-38.57
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-38-generic - 4.4.0-38.57
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-38.57').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
